Also be careful, this game is old and newer pc's do sometimes break stuff, specifically graphic drivers.

theHunter Classic is a ‚Äúfree-to-play hunting sim,‚Äù which is a polite way of saying:

> ‚ÄúDo you enjoy walking very slowly in the woods, listening to birds, and occasionally experiencing 3 seconds of pure chaos?‚Äù

You don‚Äôt run-and-gun.
You **crawl-and-hope**.

---

### The Actual Gameplay Loop

1. Spawn in.
2. Walk.
3. Walk more.
4. Hear a call.
5. Crouch-walk for 15 minutes.
6. Finally see the deer.
7. Forget to hold your breath and completely whiff the shot.

Repeat until you question your eyesight, your aim, and your life choices.

---

### Pros

* **Vibes: immaculate.**
  Forests, fields, mountains, rivers‚Äîthis game nails ‚ÄúI touched grass today, digitally.‚Äù
* Surprisingly relaxing‚Ä¶ right up until your target finally appears and your heart rate spikes like you‚Äôre defusing a bomb.
* Realistic tracking: footprints, droppings, calls. You will become way too excited about pixelated poop.
* Guns actually feel different:

  * Too big = overkill
  * Too small = ‚Äúyou just wounded it, congrats on your guilt‚Äù
* Co-op is peak comedy: four grown adults whispering into mics about an elk that immediately smells them and sprints to another zip code.

---

### Cons

* If you‚Äôre impatient, this isn‚Äôt a game‚Äîit‚Äôs a **punishment**.

  * You will walk for 20 minutes
  * Misstep once
  * Animal gone
  * Back to cardio
* F2P but with ‚Äúyou sure don‚Äôt *have* to spend money‚Ä¶ but look at these nice guns and licenses üëÄ‚Äù energy.
* The learning curve is basically:

  * ‚ÄúYou scared it.‚Äù
  * ‚ÄúYou scared it again.‚Äù
  * ‚ÄúYou hit it badly; enjoy tracking blood for 40 minutes.‚Äù
* Hard to explain to non-gamers:

  > ‚ÄúI spent my night in a virtual forest and got excited about hearing a distant grunt.‚Äù

---

### Peak theHunter Classic Moments

* Crouch-walking for ages, lining up the perfect shot, clicking the mouse‚Ä¶ **safety was on.** Deer leaves. You leave emotionally.

* Hearing a call, doing everything right, wind in your favor, perfect cover‚Ä¶ and then a random rabbit sprints past and ruins the entire stalk.

* Multiplying your monitor‚Äôs brightness, leaning forward IRL, and convincing yourself that blurry brown pixel is definitely a whitetail.

* Finally dropping a big animal cleanly and posing for trophy pics like you didn‚Äôt just spend 45 minutes chasing one dot on the minimap.

---

**9/10**
Less ‚Äúaction game‚Äù and more ‚Äúzen hiking sim where you occasionally commit ballistic math.‚Äù

Would once again boot it up ‚Äúfor a chill hunt,‚Äù walk in a straight line for half an hour, miss the only shot I get, and still call it a great session because the trees looked nice.
Good game for people who liked call of the wild and wanted more of a challenge

Most realistic and enjoyable online hunting game there is. Compatible with several different hunting techniques. Can have a fair amount of success without spending a ton, and you can get in game currency by winning competitions and and completing missions. Best game I've ever played.

Great game if you want a classic oldschool hunting experience. The different festive events give it a fresh breath of life(that is when the developers manage to roll out the events on time). Game has bugs here and there but its awesome and i love it.

1 hour in and theHunter: Classic is surprisingly immersive. The environments feel alive, tracking animals is satisfying, and the realistic mechanics make every hunt exciting. A great start for hunting fans.

I think my life would be incomplete without this game in it. I live in the north west of Oregon. It is my general archery season right now for Roosevelt elk; but I am glad to be giving this amazing game a review. I have and will continue to tell or convince anyone willing to listen, whether their young, or old, a gamer or not, a hunter or not to play this game. I have talked 2 people into buying a laptop and a desktop just to  play this game and still play with with them to this day, neither of them had had a steam account before that. For any one reading this: good games are not about graphics or the depth of story but by how it is able to pull your emotions out and make you feel as if playing the game wasn't a waste of your life.. I don't regret any moment spent in this game. To all the hunters out there It's as close as it gets to the real thing hands down 100% and if you say it isn't, your either not a hunter or a hunter that has paid big $$$ for what ever trophy animal they had handed to them or someone that hunts from the front seat of their truck.. 
Anyway, if I had to say one thing to try and get people to play this game it would be this, if you're looking for an easy  quick thrill of a game, one that you won't ever remember after you're done playing it because you're weak and just want a gimme easy and have a "everyone gets a trophy" type mentality.. This game might not be the one you want but it might be the game you need to play to make you stronger as an individual. This game will make you remember every shot you take or hours spent looking for an animal. I've played on and off as much as I could for over 10 years and have a memory from every hunt. I moved to the middle of nowhere and all the time i didn't play was due to lack of internet capabilities. 
To the people that keep this game going, I have a love and respect for you that I can't explain. I think you are all extremely amazing people and i hope myself and anyone that enjoys wild life and amazing wild places get the chance to see the joy this game can bring to a person's life. I hope that no matter what in life happens that this game is here for people to play, and I hope I can play it until the day I die. 
Thank you.

How is this game that old and still better than anything on today‚Äôs market? It has such good mechanics and ideas. If this game were made today, it would be the best hunting game on the market - and it wouldn‚Äôt even be close. Even though it‚Äôs old, it still holds up really well. Okay, I only have a few hours in it, but I can already tell I‚Äôm enjoying it way more than the others. Like, how is COTW so much worse? You already had the perfect formula here.
it‚Äôs slow-paced but rewarding. The environments are absolutely gorgeous even for its age

Really fun and enjoyable. It‚Äôs simple, smooth, and entertaining, with great gameplay and good vibes all around. Addictive and satisfying, I keep coming back for more. Overall, a solid game that‚Äôs fun, relaxing, and has just the right amount of challenge.

If you enjoy a slow-paced, realistic hunting experience, give it a try. There's a steep learning curve, but the satisfaction of a successful hunt is well worth it. Prepare for long walks and misses, but enjoy beautiful scenery and wildlife.

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to channel your inner hunter without leaving your house, theHunter Classic is basically a wildlife safari on steroids. ü¶åüéØ
The game nails realism: 45 species with authentic behaviors, massive open worlds from the Louisiana swamps to the Austrian Alps, and day/night cycles plus dynamic weather that make every hunt feel alive. Weapons range from crossbows to sniper rifles, and even your tracking skills actually matter‚Äîspot the tracks, line up the shot, and savor that satisfying ‚Äúding‚Äù when you bag the perfect trophy.
Co-op with friends makes it even better: plan a hunt, track your prey, and compare trophy shots. The community is huge and friendly, full of tips, stories, and brag-worthy achievements. And the best part? A ton of content is free to start, so you can dive in immediately.
Basically: theHunter Classic is a masterclass in hunting realism and patience, with just enough thrill to keep your heart racing. 10/10, my trophy lodge is growing, and I haven‚Äôt left my chair once. üèπüå≤

I want to state upfront I am not down voting this game because I think the game play is bad.  I think this is an amazing hunting sim.  The reason I don't recommend this game is because of how the cash shop works.  Yes it is free to play but the grind is painful compared to other hunting sims vs time invested into your hunt.  The hunts can take anywhere from fifteen minutes to over an hour and you don't get much free currency for your efforts.  The missions aren't much better and can take just as long to complete.  Combine this with high cost on the items in the market if you want to get them for free.

This is why I haven't been able to get into the game despite the challenge and the excellent hunting.  The game is extremely grindy and you will have to chose between this and other games.  If you want to focus on this then I do recommend this but if you have other games you want to play, other hunting sims or a work schedule that doesn't give you much time to play this isn't the game for you.   I would 100% come back if they lowered the bar to entry in the game via the in game shop so please don't take this as I am trying to make the game sound bad.

This game has dark patterns that would make a korean mmo dev giggle. 10-30 gm per kill and but yet anything you want out of the store is 10k+. its crazy that there are people defending this crap, its no suprise a game wants you to spend money but these guys expect you to either open your wallet or be brain dead enough to play for 200+hrs before you can buy a scope
Downloaded to play a hunting game for some peace and experience. Tried launching several times and crashes every time.

So, while the game play is probably the best for a hunting game.  Everything else is pure garbage.
Current Steam Charts are saying the game averages around 475 active monthly players.

New Official Discord server that has no moderation.  The game is advertised to be free to play,  but everything is overpriced for in game currency.  There have been tons of suggestions made via discord to make the game more appealing to new players but they don't get read by the dev team (a 3d art studio is claimed to be the active dev)  and everything gets drowned in "the game doesn't need this" by a handful of discord dwellers that just sit on there to try and start arguments (moderation team allows this).  

"But they run weekly sales!"  those sales only apply to the pay to win currency.

"Just grind missions! it only take 1.5 mission packs to afford a gun!"  while this is true, you will have to shell out money for it despite being free to play.  And to do that 1.5 mission packs discord says you can do that in 24 hours!  No, no where close to true.  When I started it took well over a week to even be close to affording a gun that I could do 1 mission with, then it never got used again because it sucked.

"They take suggestions to better the game!"... no.  Their discord is where suggestions go to die without being acknowledged by developers let alone server admin or moderators.  Unless the admin wants to approve a post on your suggestion that says you are wrong.  that's something?  I guess?

It boils down to EW made probably the best hunting game ever, and it's been on life support for years now and has an art studio/advertising company claimed as the developer.  Unless you want to sink about 400 hours into the game to be able to afford about 1/3 of the guns, 1/8th the camo required, go elsewhere.  I hear Skyrim has a better hunting experience that COTW and won't try to empty your wallet like EW does.

Attempted to play the game and during the tutorial- the deer was invisible aside from the antlers. I had to shoot it blind... which I made an amazing shot! So when starting the game, I struggle to track, but finally figured it out. I had like 9 marks on the ground and was hearing noises, but for the life of me COULD NOT SEE ANYTHING. So Idk if the game is bugged... or stuff was glitched to be invisible, but I gave up.

"Father and son outing and How!"

I only just finished the tutorial but here is my opinion.

Weapon sway is outrageous. Movement is slow and clunky. Oh guess what, the game barely gives any movement help. I spent like 25% of the tutorial on the ground crawling because there was no way to look up the keybindings to figure out how to stand back up. 
W,A,S,D standard movement
"C" toggle run/sprint
"Ctrl" crouch - x2 lay down
"hold "W" and push "Shift" to stand up
"Tab" opens up gps - x2 map
"#'s" hotkeys for gear (weapon, calls etc)
"spacebar" with weapon aimed down sight (ADS) is holding breath for like 3 seconds at most. 

This is my rage quit notification. hopefully the dev's or the next new player can use this info to make their game a better play through.

the game is bugged as hell, it does not register the pressing of stuff it asks.
in the tutorial it states "go to the dome" when it's actually the little dumb circle on the floor.

this game is very bad and has nothing to do with hunting at all. no quality or even good setting.

I would play this game if there was a way to actually play it offline so you didn't have to rely on the servers going down one day and losing all of your progress.  That is why I still occasionally play COTW since it can be played offline since there are save files and profiles.  COTW has aged badly though and all the devs do now is rely on PicSoul to moderate their steam forums while they release mediocre DLC instead of making their game look better and increase the view distance for animals.

Maybe one day if they unban me from the Steam Forums I'll give them a fair shake, but my opinion has been tainted for at least 4+ years now.

A really terrible game that requires a bunch of micro-transactions. However, even with those, I can't see how this would be fun. Lots of aimless walking around. I shot something with the correct caliber and it gave me zero in-game money, which is already worthless as it is. Don't bother.

"Father and son outing and How!"

I only just finished the tutorial but here is my opinion.

Weapon sway is outrageous. Movement is slow and clunky. Oh guess what, the game barely gives any movement help. I spent like 25% of the tutorial on the ground crawling because there was no way to look up the keybindings to figure out how to stand back up. 
W,A,S,D standard movement
"C" toggle run/sprint
"Ctrl" crouch - x2 lay down
"hold "W" and push "Shift" to stand up
"Tab" opens up gps - x2 map
"#'s" hotkeys for gear (weapon, calls etc)
"spacebar" with weapon aimed down sight (ADS) is holding breath for like 3 seconds at most. 

This is my rage quit notification. hopefully the dev's or the next new player can use this info to make their game a better play through.

I want to state upfront I am not down voting this game because I think the game play is bad.  I think this is an amazing hunting sim.  The reason I don't recommend this game is because of how the cash shop works.  Yes it is free to play but the grind is painful compared to other hunting sims vs time invested into your hunt.  The hunts can take anywhere from fifteen minutes to over an hour and you don't get much free currency for your efforts.  The missions aren't much better and can take just as long to complete.  Combine this with high cost on the items in the market if you want to get them for free.

This is why I haven't been able to get into the game despite the challenge and the excellent hunting.  The game is extremely grindy and you will have to chose between this and other games.  If you want to focus on this then I do recommend this but if you have other games you want to play, other hunting sims or a work schedule that doesn't give you much time to play this isn't the game for you.   I would 100% come back if they lowered the bar to entry in the game via the in game shop so please don't take this as I am trying to make the game sound bad.

This game has dark patterns that would make a korean mmo dev giggle. 10-30 gm per kill and but yet anything you want out of the store is 10k+. its crazy that there are people defending this crap, its no suprise a game wants you to spend money but these guys expect you to either open your wallet or be brain dead enough to play for 200+hrs before you can buy a scope
Downloaded to play a hunting game for some peace and experience. Tried launching several times and crashes every time.

So, while the game play is probably the best for a hunting game.  Everything else is pure garbage.
Current Steam Charts are saying the game averages around 475 active monthly players.

New Official Discord server that has no moderation.  The game is advertised to be free to play,  but everything is overpriced for in game currency.  There have been tons of suggestions made via discord to make the game more appealing to new players but they don't get read by the dev team (a 3d art studio is claimed to be the active dev)  and everything gets drowned in "the game doesn't need this" by a handful of discord dwellers that just sit on there to try and start arguments (moderation team allows this).  

"But they run weekly sales!"  those sales only apply to the pay to win currency.

"Just grind missions! it only take 1.5 mission packs to afford a gun!"  while this is true, you will have to shell out money for it despite being free to play.  And to do that 1.5 mission packs discord says you can do that in 24 hours!  No, no where close to true.  When I started it took well over a week to even be close to affording a gun that I could do 1 mission with, then it never got used again because it sucked.

"They take suggestions to better the game!"... no.  Their discord is where suggestions go to die without being acknowledged by developers let alone server admin or moderators.  Unless the admin wants to approve a post on your suggestion that says you are wrong.  that's something?  I guess?

It boils down to EW made probably the best hunting game ever, and it's been on life support for years now and has an art studio/advertising company claimed as the developer.  Unless you want to sink about 400 hours into the game to be able to afford about 1/3 of the guns, 1/8th the camo required, go elsewhere.  I hear Skyrim has a better hunting experience that COTW and won't try to empty your wallet like EW does.

Attempted to play the game and during the tutorial- the deer was invisible aside from the antlers. I had to shoot it blind... which I made an amazing shot! So when starting the game, I struggle to track, but finally figured it out. I had like 9 marks on the ground and was hearing noises, but for the life of me COULD NOT SEE ANYTHING. So Idk if the game is bugged... or stuff was glitched to be invisible, but I gave up.
